title: Software maker Sophos agrees £3bn takeover by US private equity
text:
Cybersecurity company Sophos has agreed to be taken over by American private equity fund Thoma Bravo for $4bn (£3.2bn).

The deal values the FTSE 250 business at 583p a share, a 37pc premium to its closing price on Friday.

Sophos' shares leapt 36pc in early trade to almost match the offer price.

The Oxford-headquartered company, which makes network security and antivirus software, had reported a decline in billings and new customer sign-ups in its last financial results.

Sophos chairman Peter Gyenes advised shareholders to accept the offer. "Under Thoma Bravo's ownership we expect Sophos to accelerate its evolution and leadership in next-generation cybersecurity," he said.
